item.title: Cramér-Chernoff bound
item.author: Author
item.description: As a prerequisite, we will need Markov’s inequality. Markov For a random variable \( Z\geq 0 \), and \( x>0 \), $$ \mathbb{P}[Z \geq x] \leq \frac{ \mathbb{E}[Z]} {x}. $$ Cramér-Chernoff This is an exponential bound, derived by applying Markov to exponentiated \(Z\), and optimising the RHS. For \( \lambda\geq 0 \), Markov implies $$ \mathbb{P}[Z \geq x] = \mathbb{P}\left[ e^{\lambda Z} \geq e^{\lambda x} \right] \leq \mathbb{E}\left[e^{\lambda Z}\right] e^{-\lambda x}.

item.title: Tsybakov's low-noise condition
item.author: Author
item.description: Consider binary classification.
